<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13 is: A pointer should point to a const-qualified type whenever possible.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of metal_device_open:
```c
int metal_device_open(const char *bus_name, const char *dev_name,
		      struct metal_device **device)
{
	struct metal_bus *bus;
	int error;

	if (!bus_name || !strlen(bus_name) ||
	    !dev_name || !strlen(dev_name) ||
	    !device)
		return -EINVAL;

	error = metal_bus_find(bus_name, &bus);
	if (error)
		return error;

	if (!bus->ops.dev_open)
		return -ENODEV;

	error = (*bus->ops.dev_open)(bus, dev_name, device);
	if (error)
		return error;

	return 0;
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are close to the target function metal_device_open:
struct metal_bus {
	const char		*name;
	struct metal_bus_ops	ops;
	struct metal_list	devices;
	struct metal_list	node;
}
...
struct metal_device {
	const char             *name;       /**< Device name */
	struct metal_bus       *bus;        /**< Bus that contains device */
	unsigned int           num_regions; /**< Number of I/O regions in
						 device */
	struct metal_io_region regions[METAL_MAX_DEVICE_REGIONS]; /**< Array of
							I/O regions in device*/
	struct metal_list      node;       /**< Node on bus' list of devices */
	int                    irq_num;    /**< Number of IRQs per device */
	void                   *irq_info;  /**< IRQ ID */
}
</additional code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
	struct metal_bus       *bus;        /**< Bus that contains device */
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 8.13 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: No violation: the pointer 'struct metal_bus *bus' refers to a mutable bus object and is passed to operations (e.g. bus->ops.dev_open) that take a non-const struct metal_bus *. Declaring it const would prevent required mutations. (If in fact the bus were only ever read and never modified, then it should be const; but evidence here shows it is used as mutable.)
